reviewText:
For the people who cannot read that it says European, that means it plays only UK (PAL) or Standard European (SECAM). Television in North America us NTSC'

Fletcher (Ronnie Barker) and his hapless cellmate Lennie (Richard Beckinsdale) was doing time -Porridge- in Slade Prison. Fetch has a give test stretch to do.

The fun happens when the prisoners try to get over on Mr. Mackay (Fulton Mackay). Doing Porridge meant a lot of time in your hands and getting Mr. Mackay in an uproar passed the hours.

Ronnie Barker is tremendous as Fletcher. His good nature combined with his desire for some of the finer things available in prison, legal or not, made for great viewing. Porridge, for those with multisystem DVD players and televisions is well worth the price.

Had heard great things about this series and I wasn't disappointed. Enjoying it so much, still only about half way through, that I ordered the sequel "Going Straight". I also enjoyed "Open All Hours", another series staring Ronnie Barker.
Didn't work at all - probably works for the UK & Europe only!
Excellent series.

Great comedy stands the test of time - this is great comedy - still makes me laugh some 40 years later. I grew up watching this and remembered it fondly.

Fletcher!!!
Well written, well portrayed, a smidgen of the dialogue might be perceived as being incomprehensible to non-English viewers but I feel sure that even they will enjoy the overall presentation.
does not matter what I think of this movie I bought it as a gift for someone else and they enjoyed it so that made me happy

Hilarious! TV in the 70s was not bogged down with being "politically correct".  This show is a riot!

great series .
script / acting : superb .
Always great to see Ronnie Barker. I love this comedy series.

One of, if not the best comedy shows of it's era, you know, the era before political correctness! It couldn't be shown now or the broadcast company would be in huge trouble with the PC brigade and broadcast commission. Great, great show though!!
very good we needed the subtitles.
Good, but not the best vehicle for him. Just my opinion.
Love Ronnie Barker in everything I've seen him in.  Don't miss this series.
As described and on time
My favourite of all Ronnie Barker's work!
very good vhs
